TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SpeechSynthesisConnector extends System.IO.Stream

Docs.summary: SpeechSynthesisConnector can be attached to an AudioVideoFlow, and provides a Stream interface to feed audio data to the flow.

remarks.para: The Stream can be given to a SpeechSynthesizer as an output destination, in order to synthesize text over the wire.
SpeechSynthesisConnector should be used only in conjuction with Microsoft.Speech.

public: SpeechSynthesisConnector();

MemberSignature.Value: public void AttachFlow (Microsoft.Rtc.Collaboration.AudioVideo.AudioVideoFlow audioVideoFlow);
.method public hidebysig instance void AttachFlow(class Microsoft.Rtc.Collaboration.AudioVideo.AudioVideoFlow audioVideoFlow) cil managed
public: void AttachFlow(Microsoft::Rtc::Collaboration::AudioVideo::AudioVideoFlow ^ audioVideoFlow);

Docs.summary: Specifies which AudioVideoFlow will provide audio data for speech recognition. Only one AudioVideoFlow may be bound at a time.

example.para: The following example attaches and detaches a ToneController by the time AudioVideoFlow changes its state to Active and Terminated.
C# Attaching and detaching an AudioVideoFlow.

Docs.exception: Thrown when an AudioVideoFlow is already attached or when an AudioVideoFlow is already attached to another SpeechSynthesisConnector.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DetachFlow ();
.method public hidebysig instance void DetachFlow() cil managed
Public Sub DetachFlow ()
public: void DetachFlow();

Docs.summary: Detaches the current AudioVideoFlow, freeing the connector to use another.

remarks.para: Will NO-OP if no flow is attached.

example.para: The following example attaches and detaches a SpeechSynthesisConnector by the time AudioVideoFlow changes its state to Active and Terminated.
C# Attaching and detaching an AudioVideoFlow.

.method public hidebysig instance void Start() cil managed
Public Sub Start ()
public: void Start();

Docs.summary: Prepares the connector to accept input from the SpeechSynthesizer and transmit it to the AudioVideoFlow.

example.para: The following example starts the SpeechSynthesizerConnector.

Docs.exception: Thrown when the SpeechSynthesisConnector is already started.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Stop ();
.method public hidebysig instance void Stop() cil managed
Public Sub Stop ()
public: void Stop();

Docs.summary: Stops sending data to the AudioVideoFlow.

remarks.para: Will no-op if SpeechSynthesisConnector is already stopped, or is not attached to an AudioVideoFlow.

example.para: The following example starts and stops the SpeechSynthesizerConnector.
C# Starting and stopping a SpeechSynthesizerConnector.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.IO.Stream Stream { get; }
.property instance class System.IO.Stream Stream
Public ReadOnly Property Stream As Stream
public: property System::IO::Stream ^ Stream { System::IO::Stream ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the stream corresponding to this connector, for use as a parameter to SpeechSynthesizer.SetOutputToAudioStream().

MemberSignature.Value: public override void Write (byte[] buffer, int offset, int count);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Write(unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 offset, int32 count) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub Write (buffer As Byte(), offset As Integer, count As Integer)
public: override void Write(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ buffer, int offset, int count);

Docs.param: An array of bytes. This method copies count bytes from buffer to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.
Docs.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written. Blocks until the data has been (almost) sent on the wire.
Docs.exception: Thrown when the sum of offset and count is larger than the buffer length.
Thrown when offset or count is negative.
Thrown when the stream was already closed.
Thrown when buffer is null.
Thrown when the connector is not attached to a flow, or is not active, or has been suspended.
Thrown when the connector is stopped.
